comments: The numbers not of the form x^2+3y^2+3z^2.
references: L. J. Mordell, A new Waring's problem with squares of linear forms, Quart. J. Math., 1 (1930), 276-288 (see p. 283).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: max = 200; Select[ Union[ Flatten[ Table[ 9^i*(3*j + 2), {i, 0, Ceiling[Log[max]/Log[9]]}, {j, 0, Ceiling[( max/9^i - 2)/3]}]]], # <= max &] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Oct 13 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a055048 n = a055048_list !! (n-1)a055048_list = filter (s 0) [1..] where   s t u | m > 0  = even t && m == 2         | m == 0 = s (t + 1) u' where (u',m) = divMod u 3-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 07 2012(PARI) is(n)=n/=9^valuation(n, 9); n%3==2 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_ and _V. Raman_, Dec 19 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 01 2000
